data.title: Cillian Murphy Starring In Crime Film About 1960s Mining Murders—What To Know About The True Story Of Joseph Yablonski
meta_keywords: Cillian Murphy To Star In Crime Film About 1960s Mining Murders
Cillian Murphy Starring In Crime Film About 1960s Mining Murders
data.meta_description: "Oppenheimer" actor and Oscar winner Cillian Murphy will star in and produce an adaptation of the book "Blood Runs Coal," an epic true crime story of organized labor in the 1960s.
data.text:
Topline

Cillian Murphy, who recently won an Oscar for his performance in last year’s blockbuster historical hit “Oppenheimer,” is set to produce and star in a film adaptation of “Blood Runs Coal,” the true crime story of the murder of Joseph Yablonski and his family by a rival mining labor leader in the 1960s.

Key Facts

Crucial Quote

Steve Halvonik, book reviewer for the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, called the Yablonski murders "one of the most shocking episodes in organized labor's blood-soaked history."

Key Background

Joseph Yablonski was the son of a coal miner who died in a mining explosion in the early 1930s, prompting him to become active in the United Mine Workers labor union. Yablonski served as an executive board member and president of his local union district in Pennsylvania, while corruption ran amuck at the highest levels of union leadership in Washington, D.C., Chip Yablonski told Smithsonian Magazine. By the late 1960s, a contingency of miners were speaking against then-President Tony Boyle and his seeming commitment to mine owners’ interests above those of rank-and-file workers. Yablonski challenged Boyle for the presidency in 1969, and lost by a wide margin. Yablonski asked the federal Department of Labor to investigate the election for possible fraud. It was then that Boyle ordered Yablonski’s murder. Using $20,000 from embezzled from the union, Albert Pass, a member of the United Mine Workers’ executive council, hired three hitmen who killed Yablonski, his wife Margaret and his 25-year-old daughter, Charlotte on New Year’s Eve. Major democratization reforms followed, in the United Mine Workers, United Steelworkers and other organizations. The scandal has been the subject of several books and a 1986 HBO film titled "Act of Vengeance.”

Tangent

Cillian Murphy is no stranger to period pieces. Before he won the Academy Award for best acting in "Oppenheimer," set in 1942, he starred in the crime drama "Peaky Blinders," which is set in England in 1919. His other credits include "Dunkirk," a World War II historical thriller; "The Wind that Shakes the Barley," a story of the Irish War for Independence; and "Anthropoid," another WWII film. "Peaky Blinders" creator Steven Knight confirmed earlier this month Murphy will reprise his role as Tommy Shelby for a film follow-up to the series, which ended in 2022.

What We Don’t Know

When or where the “Blood Runs Coal” movie will be released. No production information has been released by Universal Pictures.
